topic.title: Retrieving and Changing the Admin Password

section.p: In a default HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0 installation there is a randomly generated password for the Admin user created. These steps will show you what you need to do if you wish to change this to a static password of your choosing.

section.title: Retrieving the Admin Password
section.p: You can retrieve the randomly generated Admin password by using this command on the lifecycle manager:
In this example output, the value for OS_PASSWORD is the Admin password:
section.codeblock: $ cat ~/service.osrc unset OS_DOMAIN_NAME export OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=3 export OS_AUTH_VERSION=3 export OS_PROJECT_NAME=admin export OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME=Default export OS_USERNAME=admin export OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME=Default export OS_PASSWORD=66A6XcVo export OS_AUTH_URL=http://10.13.111.145:35357/v3 export OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE=internalURL export OS_CACERT=/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt

section.title: Changing the Admin Password
section.p: Here are the steps to change the Admin password:

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager.
Source the Keystone admin creds so you can run the commands in the rest of the steps: source ~/keystone.osrc
Using the OpenStack CLI, change the Admin password: openstack user set --password <password> admin
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "changing Admin password"
Run the configuration processor with this command: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Use the playbook below to create a deployment directory: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml

Run the Keystone service reconfigure playbook which will update the necessary files with the new password: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible/ ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts keystone-deploy.yml
